column4: I want to upgrade my hardisk from 40GB to 160GB. How can I move my system from 2nd partition in 40GB disk to 1st partition in 160GB disk?
I've all my best configuration in my recent system, so how can I have this system on the new hardrive?
use something like rsync or tar to backup from the old harddrive to the new one
: but it didn't move the bootloader..
i've tried : cat /dev/sda2 > /dev/sdb1. But it has error message when booting
that's easily rectified by running reinstalling grub
cat is not suited for that purpose
: so how can i copy the whole system? using 'cp'?
how many partitions does your old setup have?  just one for / ?
mount both devices somewhere like /media/sda2 and /media/sdb2 .. then use something like this.  cd /media && sudo rsync -aAHXv sda2/ sdb2/
: two partition / and /media/data. But i only want to copy the system (/) to the new hdd (with different partition size)
then how about the bootloader?
how should I copy the bootloader from one hdd to the other?
once that command has finished running.  chroot to /media/sdb2 like this.  sudo chroot /media/sdb2 # and run this. sudo aptitude reinstall grub
: i've a problem with the rsync : "rsync: -aAHXv: unknown option"
hmm, how exactly are you using the rsync command?
sudo rsync -aAHXv / mnt/
try this.  sudo rsync -avHX / mnt/
: laban@labanux:/root$ sudo rsync -avHX / mnt/
sudo rsync -av / mnt/
ok, work in progress..
just out of curiosity .. did you wipe the sdb2 partition clean ?
because if sdb2 is of a different size to sda2 .. then it's probably going to have the wrong filesystem size now - a result of your earlier cp command
